role here is really just to set up a few things about tableau to talk about the
engineering work that we've done with AWS to make sure that tableau and AWS
work together in the ways that you all would expect and that for us really
starts with data and so we wake up every day you know different people are
motivated by different things the things that were motivated by every day this is our mission statement is to help people
see and understand data and we think that that matters more than ever we
believe that the companies and the organizations and the people that are
most effectively able to manage and manipulate and mine their data for insights will be the ones that will win
to say it simply and that the ones who struggle with that and aren't able to make that change we think those are the
come and the organizations that will struggle and so this is a very you know heartfelt
mission that we pursue every day about 15 years ago we did something that was considered a very innovative at that
time which is we made it a hell of a lot easier to ask and answer questions with your data and so the interface that you
see there made it possible to just drag and drop and ask questions and find out
why and find new insights in your data and to use visualization as a key way to
do that and it really unlocked the creativity and the curiosity of a lot of
people in the organizations that were using tableau and they felt this great power to be able to do that and over 15
years we have built a platform to support that process so that platform
involves everything from how do you connect to all your different data sources out there not gonna ask the
question but if I asked how many of you have one data source that you have to deal with no one would raise their hand it's all over the place it's in a lot of
different different places AWS and otherwise and so being able to connect
to that varied set of data being able to prepare that data so that it's really
well suited for analysis and so being able to clean up that data and put it
into a shape that works best for the analysts that you work with very
important being able to govern that process not everyone should be able to see everything some people should be
able to see a lot so that they can make sure the right capacity exists to run
the system that the right data access is being provided but not too much there's
this idea of governance overall that is a very important function that IT
continues to serve for the business and so governance built right into that platform all the way up through the
analytics which is that process that I mentioned mining that data for the four
insights that we might realize are there and insights that we might not and then up to the act of getting it out
to the broader organization whether that shared out on phones or out through
browsers even client desktop applications being able to get to that
and then discuss it and share and comment and and send it around to other
people that act of collaboration is just as important often as the act of finding
the insights to start with that is all done in the context of the security and
compliance that I talked about and one of the things that tableaus works pretty hard on is the extensibility to be able
to act to make tableau do what you want it to do to customize it to integrate it into the systems that you want to use
and so that has resulted in deployments both large and small and in a variety of
different environments and the and the environment that we're most interested
in today is the is the work that we do with AWS it is very common for customers
today to come and have one of a few discussions with us the first one is hey
my company has decided or my organization has decided that we are going to have a cloud first or a cloud

to the cloud and so the work with with AWS is really important not just to
natively integrate to the services which I'll show you in just a minute but to

prescriptive advice on how to deploy so
not only will tableau connect to a W services it will also run on top of AWS
